caption:
Master of wine @peterkofmwf said "There is good Burgundy and there is cheap Burgundy, but there is no good cheap Burgundy". Well wines like this 2021 Hautes-Cotes de Beaune from @bouchard_aine_fils challenge this. It is perfectly good everyday Chardonnay that won't break your bank. The nose has pear and green apple, the mouthfeel is oily with more green notes. Especially when the wine warms up the acidic notes subside and the round fruity notes take over. A good value for money.

Rating 4/5, great value for money.

#bourgogne #burgundy #hautescotesdebeaune #cotedor #bouchardainefils
name: Hautes-Cotes de Beaune

caption:
I have recently been into creamy South-African Chardonnay after @ilkka_siren recommended me one a few months back. These wines often have fun tropical notes such as pineapple. This spesific Chardonnay comes from @lanzeracestate in the Stellenbosch and it has notes of pineapple, vanilla and oak.

Fun everyday wine that's easy to enjoy by itself.
name: Chardonnay

caption:
With the price of land and labour in the USA it's wonderful that producers like @kenwoodvineyards can still produce well made wines at a reasonable price. This 2019 Zinfandel is more restrained than some big American Zins. The tasting notes include blueberry, spice and strawberry jam. The aftertaste is quite short.

Easy everyday wine.

Photo credits @lynlishphotography
name: Zinfandel

caption:
2023 is supposed to be a great year for whites in Burgundy and our first bottle from that vintage did not disappoint. This regional Bourgogne from @louislatour1797 has a great nose of freshly cut green apple. The pallet has more green apple flavours with a hint of butter. Good acids. Great burgundy for a fair price.

Excellent value for money.
name: Bourgogne

caption:
Trying wines from made from different areas and grape varietals is always fun. This 2023 Clos Ancestral from @familiatorreswines is made partly from the ancient Moneu grape varietal that the winery is bringing back in Penedes, Spain. The wine has a nose of strawberry jam. The pallet has more red fruit along with some pepper and a rubber note. Quite enjoyable wine.

Good everyday wine.
name: Clos Ancestral

caption:
There is no place for Syrah like Hermitage. This was proved again by this 2016 Hermitage by @domaineguigal which was drinking beautifully yesterday. The wine has a powerful nose of prune, chocolate and oak. The pallet has some classic Syrah pepper notes and lots of smooth red and dark fruits. Long aftertaste.

A true classic.
name: Hermitage

caption:
Riesling is popular here in Finland and for good reason. German white wines can rival the best white wines from France or the US and they are often better priced. Today's wine is the 2023 Riesling from @buerklinwolf from the Pfalz. They are one the best producers in Germany and their entry level wine has a nose of pear and faint hint of barnyard. The pallet has lime and some sweetness in the aftertaste. The mouthfeel is light but the intensity is good. A well made and fun wine.

More interesting than your average Riesling.
name: Riesling

caption:
Best wine I've had so far in 2025. This 2019 #jcacheux Nuits-Saint-Georges Au Bas de Combe confirms my assessment that the 2019 is a great vintage in Burgundy. The wine has a strong nose of red cherry and the taste has more red fruit with a hint of vanilla. It's like sticking your head to a berry bush and it makes you want to keep drinking more of it.

When red burgundy is done right, it's the best wine in the world.
name: Nuits-Saint-Georges Au Bas de Combe

caption:
2023 delivers again! Finland is normally Riesling country but people here should try unoaked Chardonnay like this 2023 @lachablisienne1923 Le Finage which show's a side of Chardonnay that isn't familiar to everyone. The nose of the wine has green apple and some saltiness of the sea. The pallet has lime, honey and some more green flavours. The finish is quite long.

Great value for money.
name: Le Finage

caption:
Very big wine. This wine was one of the most famous garage wines from Bordeaux and it was even controversial with its bold, almost new world style. The 2015 marojallia_sas has a nose of smoke, liquorice and black fruit. With time you can find some blue fruit notes but the finish stays very dry and smoky with hints of tobacco.

If you like big wines you might score it even higher.
name: Marojallia

caption: A rereview of the 2011 @s.a.pruem Sonnenuhr Wehlen Riesling GG. This time the wine showed even better with great complexity and evolution during the evening. When opening the bottle the wine has a nose of green apple and petroleum and with time also some golden stone fruit notes. The taste has some sweetness from the residual sugar along with nice acidity as you would except from a high quality Riesling. Mouthfeel is full with nice long aftertaste. This wine really makes us want to try some more +10 year old GG Rieslings from Germany. Rating 4.5/5 this is what Riesling is supposed to be like.
name: Sonnenuhr Wehlen Riesling GG

caption: Sometimes its worth to wait. This Rosso di Montalcino from @ilpoggione is a medium bodied Sangiovese with a lot of red fruit and a hint of smoke. However, I would personally rather spend a few more euros for a Brunello that has aged a bit more than this young Rosso di Montalcino but these kind of lighter expressions of Sangiovese have their place, especially with the right food pairing. Rating 3,5/5
name: Rosso di Montalcino

caption: Aged vs young wine. This was the question at todays wine club when we tasted the @barolomonti 2011 Barolo. Some people really enjoyed the tertiary aromas of liquorice and wet wood but others wanted a bit more fresh fruit and body. I’d say this wine fits better with lighter dishes or to be enjoyed by itself. Rating 4/5 and a great wine for friends of aged wine.
name: Barolo

caption: Summer is time for nicely chilled Riesling. This 2022 @weingutjohannishof Terra Nostra Riesling Trocken is a quite simple Riesling with a nose of green apple and wax. The taste has a hint of sugar and is dominated by citrus. The body is on the lighter side. This wine would go well with anything that goes will like citrus, like pan fried salmon or creamy chicken. Rating 3,5/5
name: Terra Nostra Riesling Trocken

caption: Summer is here and my favorite drink for the hot days is some nicely chilled German Riesling, preferably from Mosel. This 2022 wine from @weingut_paulybergweiler is exactly that. The wine has a nose of green apple and petroleum. The taste is crisp with more apple and some honey. Was amazing with Camembert, goat cheese and crackers. Rating 4/5 and an excellent value for money. Go buy it!
name: Dr. Pauly-Bergweiler

caption: More summer recommendations this time from Chile. This 2022 Las Brisas Pinot Noir from @leydawines is a lighter Pinot perfect to be enjoyed with friends with some cheese and small snacks. The wine has a nose of cherry. The pallet has more fresh red berry and it’s very easy to drink. This wine maybe does not have the same complexity than some of the higher end Pinots but you can’t fault it as it’s very reasonably priced. Rating 4/5 , good value for money.
name: Pinot Noir

caption: Started the weekend with a sweet note. This 2021 @ravenswoodwinery old vine Zinfandel is a lush and jammy wine with notes of strawberry jam, fruit candy and Chinese herbs. This is the style of wine which made me get into wine because it’s so fun and tasty. My pallet has changed to like “old world” style wines a bit more but I think many casual wine drinkers would enjoy this bottle more than something 3 times it’s price from Bordeaux or Burgundy. Rating 4/5 and good value for money.
name: Zinfandel

caption: 2016 Brunello is always a great choice and this @valdisugawines Vigna Del Lago comes from the northern slopes of Montalcino. Take your time with it and you will be treated with a nose of cherry and a pallet of plum, leather and dark cherries. The wine leaves a long aftertaste. Rating 4,5/5. Great wine with food.
name: Vigna Del Lago

caption: One of the great things about running a wine club is that our friends introduce us to new wines. This 2014 @terredora Taurasi Aglianico is a real gem from Campania. Deep purple colour with a nose of plums and boysenberries. In the taste the bottle age had softened the tannins leaving a strong dark fruit flavour and a long aftertaste. Rating 4+/5 and a great value for money.
name: Taurasi Aglianico

caption: Ending the workweek on a sweet note. This 2020 @st_antony Baron Heyl Estate Riesling has 35g/l sugar making it a perfect match to enjoy with some spicy Thai basil chicken (Pad Krapow Gai). You should definitely pick a bottle up if you have a sweet tooth. Rating 3,5/5
name: Baron Heyl Estate Riesling
